description.narrative: (i) Increase access to finance for SMEs in the country through longer tenor products and trade finance instruments. (ii) Stimulate growth in underdeveloped markets, support economic recovery through job creation by SMEs in an IDA country. (iii) Support KICB''s efforts to diversify and increase the volume of their funding base and to better manage their assets and liabilities. (iv) Support the development of trade finance sector in Kyrgyz Republic.

Kyrgyz Investment and Credit Bank (KICB or the Bank) is a closed joint-stock company, which was incorporated in the Kyrgyz Republic in 2001. Since the Bank was established, the Bank has gradually developed as one of the leading providers of financial services to private sector in the country. KICB is currently the second largest bank in terms of total assets and loan portfolio and the first largest bank in terms of total capital in the country. KICB runs its operations through 10 branches and 19 sub-branches, mainly located in the regions, and the Head Office located in Bishkek. The project involves a potential senior loan of up to US$10 million and a trade finance guarantee facility of US$2 million to Kyrgyz Investment and Credit Bank (KICB or the Bank), an existing IFC client, one of the most active providers of financial services to private sector of the Kyrgyz Republic. IFC would play an important developmental role by providing KICB with additional longer term resources for on-lending to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), which have limited access to long-term funding. In addition, IFCs trade finance guarantee facility will support access to trade finance for local exporters and importers and address the counterparty risk that is slowing down the growth of trade business in the country.

participating-org.narrative: Kyrgyz Investment and Credit Bank CJSC

name.narrative: KICB is headquartered in Bishkek, the Kyrgyz Republic, and is present in most of the populated regions of the country. The proposed IFC loan would be used by the Bank for on-lending to private SMEs in the Kyrgyz Republic
